content.title: Scholarship to Meritorious Student of Fishers Family
content.details: The 'Scholarship to Meritorious Student of Fishers Family' Component of the 'Mukhyamantri Maschyajibi Kalyan Yojana' was launched to generate interest among the meritorious students of the family of the fishermen, providing one-time assistance to the pass-outs of the HSC examination for pursuing higher education.
benefits: Percentage of Marks Secured: 80% and above; Scholarship: ₹20,000/-
Percentage of Marks Secured: 70% and up to 80%; Scholarship: ₹15,000/-
Percentage of Marks Secured: 60% and up to 70%; Scholarship: ₹10,000/-
eligibility: The applicant should be a Student.
The applicant should be a member of the family of a fisherman.
The applicant should have secured 60% or above marks in the HSC Examination.
The applicant should not be availing of a scholarship under ST & SC Development, Minorities & Backward Classes Welfare Department, KALIA Scheme, etc.
content.application_process: Offline. The applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all mandatory fields, attach required documents, and submit it to the Assistant Fisheries Officer (AFO) of the concerned block.
documents_required: An undertaking countersigned by concerned AFO/STA/JFTA, stating that the applicant has not availed of any kind of scholarship/award from any Department.

faqs.question: How does the assistance pattern vary based on the percentage of marks secured in the HSC examination?
faqs.answer: The cash award varies, with ₹20,000 for 80% and above, ₹15,000 for 70% to 80%, and ₹10,000 for 60% to 70% in the HSC examination.

faqs.question: What is the geographical scope of this scholarship scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is applicable across the entire state, covering 30 District Fisheries Officers and 5 Marine Units.

faqs.question: Can a meritorious student receive the scholarship more than once?
faqs.answer: No, the award is a one-time assistance provided to each meritorious student.

faqs.question: Are there any restrictions on students already benefiting from other scholarships?
faqs.answer: Yes, students availing scholarships under ST & SC Development, Minorities & Backward Classes Welfare Department, KALIA scheme, etc., are not eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: How is the final list of meritorious students ensured to be accurate and non-duplicative?
faqs.answer: The Addl. Fishery Officer (Marine) submits the final list to the District Fisheries Officer, ensuring accurate representation and avoiding duplication.

faqs.question: What is the role of District Fisheries Officers in disbursing the assistance?
faqs.answer: District Fisheries Officers release the assistance directly into the Aadhaar linked bank accounts of students through DBT/NEFT/RTGS.

faqs.question: Who oversees the monitoring, reporting, and supervision of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Director of Fisheries, Odisha, oversees the monitoring and supervision through the respective District Fisheries Officers/Additional Fisheries Officers, Marine.

faqs.question: How is the scheme publicized at both state and district levels?
faqs.answer: State-level publicity is handled by the Director of Fisheries, Odisha, while district-level publicity is managed through posters and wall paintings by District Fisheries Officers and Additional Fisheries Officers, Marine.

faqs.question: Can district officials make adjustments to their allocated targets?
faqs.answer: Yes, district officials have the flexibility to enhance their targets up to 25% and reallocate block targets based on demand.

faqs.question: What is the timeline for the identification and disbursement of the scholarship to eligible candidates?
faqs.answer: The timeline involves identifying suitable candidates within 15 days, submission of documents within 15 days, scrutiny within 15 days, and disbursement within 15 days of scrutinization.

faqs.question: Who verifies the information provided in the application form?
faqs.answer: The AFO/SFTA/JFTA verifies the information furnished by the applicant, confirming its accuracy and the applicant's eligibility.

faqs.question: What enclosures are required along with the scholarship application form?
faqs.answer: Enclosures include a photocopy of the mark sheet, caste certificate, college admission receipt, bank passbook, Aadhar card, residential certificate, income certificate, and a passport photo of the applicant.
